title: Drawing, ca. 1763
medium: Brush and watercolor, black chalk on cream laid paper
markings:
Stamp:  Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration in black on verso, upper right edge, lower right corner:  Lugt no. 457d

Watermark: D & C BLAUW under a horn in an escutcheon, surmounted by a crown (Churchill 329)
inscribed: Inscribed in brown ink: upper center: N° 9 hauteur du Saladiere uni p're grandeur; in graphite, lower right corner: 3; in graphite, lower right edge, sideways:  P. 11 [?]
provenance:
Giovanni Piancastelli
Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: View of decagonal salad bowl (after a silver form) in elevation (above) and plan (below) with scattered floral sprays. View of bowl in plan shows rim of bowl decorated with five floral clusters. Blue and gold border lines.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, ca. 1763.
ca. 1763. Brush and watercolor, black chalk on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-8310.
